content:
I've just merged the Nea webserver platform and 3 example applications https://github.com/tweedegolf/nea/tree/main/benchmarks/roc-nea

these are very basic, and that is kind of the point. We plan on also implementing these for rust+nea, rust+tokio and nodejs. But having other languages, especially "traditional" backend languages like ruby or php in there would give us stronger results.

I don't really know those languages, but contributions are very welcome.

(also for the impatient I guess you can use nea + roc now)
